availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. McFarland (Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer & state house rep)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Person County, North Carolina, native. Married to Elizabeth Griffith McFarland in October 1816. Father of Penelope McFarland Barron, Lucinda McFarland, and Lucy McFarland. Married to Harriet Leaman McFarland. Father of Walter McFarland, Vitula McFarland, William Stanford McFarland, Satira McFarland, John McFarland, and Robert McFarland. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1848. Farmer in Daviess County in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Farmer in Owensboro, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons (including Atha) in Owensboro in 1860.

ab.bibl:
